subject: Re: [junit] iterative testing
msgSnippet: You want multiple failures.  JFunc does that, probably a few others extensions do as well. http://jfunc.sourceforge.net/ -shane
messageBody:
You want multiple failures. JFunc does that, probably a few others
extensions do as well.

http://jfunc.sourceforge.net/

-shane

On Monday, October 7, 2002, at 07:44 AM, beuys1234 wrote:

> Servus,
> I think that should be a common known problem, but I didn't find any
> answer in the FAQs so I try it here.
>
> I have a tree-like structure with URLs that I have to check. I want
> to walk through the tree recursively and check the URL at each node.
> If one of the URLs are corrupted I want to throw a failure or an
> error and proceed with checking.
>
> What I don't want to have is to fill a Map or something like that,
> where I collect corrupted URLs, while I don't throw a failure each
> time i foun a bad URL, but printing the corruptedLinksList after
> TestTermination.
> Insted of this, I would like to generate a TestCase for each URL in
> the tree dynamicaly at runtime and run this TestCase at each URL-node
> of the tree.
> Is this possible? Is there any example, how to do this? Does anyone
> have any better idea?
>
> Have a nice and peacefull day!
>
> Wolfgang
>
>
